main event: A detailed report from August 30, 1952, in Los Gatos, California, described a bright silvery object about 30-40 feet in diameter, traveling at high speed, changing directions and altitude rapidly.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 200-220 miles per hour and disappeared over the mountains.
The witness, an attorney and a trained technician on aircraft, provided his qualifications to lend credibility to the report.
The report was received late, and the questionnaire envelope had been opened before it was delivered.
On August 15, 1952, a separate report from Los Gatos described circular objects the size of stars flying in a semi 'V' formation at a speed of 300-350 mph.
During a Mexican Fiestas in Los Gatos, several people witnessed the object.
sighted object: bright silvery object about 30-40 feet in diameter traveling at high speed
witnesses: Attorney and several other people during a Mexican Fiestas
